main event: A bright, white, flashing light was observed moving back and forth over San Bernardino, California on January 27, 1958.
interesting points: The light was described as the size of a dime and was seen by multiple witnesses, including a woman taking out the garbage and her son who viewed it through binoculars.
The light moved very fast, zig-zagging and circling before dropping out of view.
The sighting lasted for approximately 5 minutes.
The object was initially thought to be a 'new kind of anti-collision light being tested', but was later determined to be a T-33 jet aircraft with a new type of light to make it more visible.
Several other aircraft, including two other T-birds and a C-45, were also observed in the area at the time of the sighting.
result: Explained - T-33 jet aircraft with new lighting system
witnesses: A woman taking out the garbage and her son
